My battalion shipped out just 10 days before the bombing. Every year, it does not get any easier to think of my fellow Marines who never made it back home.

I promised I would never forget them, and remembering the 1983 Beirut Barracks Attack is part of that promise.

As a battle liaison officer, I spent time ashore, and many nights in which I would go to the roof of the Marine barracks and look out across the city.¬†The sight of lone American flag on the horizon is something that is still deeply sentimental for me to this day. üá∫üá∏ https://t.co/Jt9h6kJLMH

In 1983,¬†as a First Lieutenant in the 3rd Battalion, 3rd Marines, we were ordered to Beirut, Lebanon as part of the multinational peacekeeping force during the Lebanese Civil War. https://t.co/mvyE8F50Cz

38 years ago today, 241 brave Americans lost their lives in a terrorist attack on the @USMC Barracks in Beirut, Lebanon.

Today we honor their great sacrifice for our freedom, and remain faithful in our promise that this tragedy will never be forgotten.
